prompt: <description>**Intermediate Part 1: Three-dimensional Rectangular Prism** The first part of the assembly is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The part has a uniform gray color and is centered. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 1 unit in height. The sloped side has a diagonal length of approximately 2.8 units. *Step 1: Draw a 2D sketch* Create a new coordinate system with the Euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector of [0.0, 0.5, 0.0]. Within this coordinate system, draw a 2D sketch on the XY-plane. The sketch should have a single face (face\\_1) with one loop (loop\\_1) composed of six lines (line\\_1 to line\\_6) as follows: 1. line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] 2. line\\_2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.25] 3. line\\_3: Start Point [0.75, 0.25], End Point [0.25, 0.25] 4. line\\_4: Start Point [0.25, 0.25], End Point [0.25, 0.625] 5. line\\_5: Start Point [0.25, 0.625], End Point [0.0, 0.625] 6. line\\_6: Start Point [0.0, 0.625], End Point [0.0, 0.0] *Step 2: Scale the 2D sketch* Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter sketch\\_scale: 0.75. *Step 3: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch* Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by 0.5 units and in the opposite direction by 0.0 units, creating a 3D model. *Step 4: Finalize the intermediate CAD part* The first intermediate CAD part is complete with a height of 0.75 units, width of 0.5 units, and length of 0.75 units. Continue with the next intermediate CAD part within the final shape, following the JSON data provided.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Tapered Top and Bottom The first part is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a tapered top and bottom. Create a new coordinate system with the Euler angles set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the Translation Vector set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Sketching the Base Face 1. On the XY plane, create a loop with the following lines: - Line 1: Starting at [0.0, 0.0], ending at [0.5, 0.0]. - Line 2: Starting at [0.5, 0.0], ending at [0.5, 0.25]. - Line 3: Starting at [0.5, 0.25], ending at [0.3333, 0.25]. - Line 4: Starting at [0.3333, 0.25], ending at [0.3333, 0.4167]. - Line 5: Starting at [0.3333, 0.4167], ending at [0.3333, 0.5833]. - Line 6: Starting at [0.3333, 0.5833], ending at [0.1667, 0.5833]. - Line 7: Starting at [0.1667, 0.5833], ending at [0.1667, 0.4167]. - Line 8: Starting at [0.1667, 0.4167], ending at [0.1667, 0.25]. - Line 9: Starting at [0.1667, 0.25], ending at [0.0, 0.25]. - Line 10: Starting at [0.0, 0.25], ending at [0.0, 0.0]. Extruding the Sketch 1. With the base face as the selection, set the extrusion depth towards the normal as 0.4167 and the opposing depth as 0.0. 2. Apply the scaling factor to the sketch as 0.5833. 3. Perform the 'New Body Feature Operation' to create the first part. The final dimensions of the part are: - Length: 0.5833 - Width: 0.5833 - Height: 0.4167</description>
